data.text: O Lord, Father and Governor of my life,
Who will set scourges over my thoughts,
Lest mine ignorances increase,
O Lord, Father and God of my life,
Turn away concupiscence from me.
Let not the greediness of the belly nor lust of the flesh take hold of me;
Hear, O ye children, the discipline of the mouth:
The sinner shall be left in his foolishness:
Accustom not thy mouth to swearing;
For as a servant that is continually beaten shall not be without a blue mark:
A man that useth much swearing shall be filled with iniquity,
There is a word that is clothed about with death:
Use not thy mouth to intemperate swearing,
Remember thy father and thy mother,
The man that is accustomed to opprobrious words
Two sorts of men multiply sin,
All bread is sweet to a whoremonger,
A man that breaketh wedlock,
Such a man only feareth the eyes of men,
He knew all things ere ever they were created;
This man shall be punished in the streets of the city,
Thus shall it go also with the wife that leaveth her husband,
For first, she hath disobeyed the law of the most High;
She shall be brought out into the congregation,
Her children shall not take root,
She shall leave her memory to be cursed,
And they that remain shall know that there is nothing better than the fear of the Lord,
